message: The problem is they cry wolf too many times...and then not warn us enough next time and we get hit with a real blizzard!

@Jera: not a troll. I just don't have my facebook open for non friends to see. I never said there was claims for 97 different restrooms. I was asking a question since no one has proposed a viable or common sense solution yet. Please learn to read before calling others dim-witted. So please present a solution that is equal for everyone and not just any select group...

no freeking way does draper 'realize' who he is. the one thing 'draper' is about is using what is at hand to improve his own station in life -- and no one else's particularly. that happened in korea, it happened when he first met sterling, and it happened at various times during his career and in his personal life. the ending is no different. advertising to that point had been all about communicating to american society that was on the move outward -- in cars and planes while selling stuff and consuming, at any cost. sitting there with the meditators, draper now understands that american culture in 1971 or whenever was turning inward, as it would on many levels for the next 20 years at least. his epiphany, as it was for his entire industry at that time, was to change direction, too. hence, that endlessly aggravating coke commercial, which is all about making ourselves feel good about ourselves. which, of course, is consistent with the ultimate draper-ism: 'happiness is what we feel the moment before we crave more happiness.'
